content: Is there a tool like this for Rust? https://embed.cs.utah.edu/csmith/
I don't think so. At least the rust repo doesn't have any fuzzer tests.
I think there is afl, this: https://llvm.org/docs/LibFuzzer.html via cargo-fuzz, also hongfuzz
Afl is a lot more limited than csmith though. It fuzzes raw bytes, csmith only generates valid C code
I'm not aware of any equivalent to csmith.
(I think there have been some efforts, though; e.g. see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/78336 which notes it was generated by a WIP tool called Kira, and reduced by Perses.
Yeah, a lot of issues have been opened that say they were discovered with Kira/Perses.
Yes, I think so. But Kira seems to be a program that generates programs to try to find bugs in rustc.

From the issue:

The bug is found by our work-in-progress compiler testing tool Kira
